WRITING.TEXT:
I'd recommend International Superhits. Not an "album" but a great way to get into their early work.
American Idiot and Dookie are of course the most commercially successful but my personal favourite three albums are(in no particular order): -Dos! -Kerplunk -Nimrod
edit-spelling
The same for me. Thankfully Demolicious partially makes up for it
Same here! It's the Hot Topic Aqua Blue exclusive, I'm unsure if all vinyl of Dos are like this or whether it's just the Aqua Blue.

WRITING.TITLE: After listening to Dos! with Drama Queen, I am very glad it got moved to Tr!...it really slows the pace of the album

WRITING.TITLE: My latest purchase. Was a bargain at 14!

WRITING.TEXT: As the title says I picked this up for 15 at my nearest record shop (around 55 miles away). Sadly, the store owner was struggling to pay rent (mentioned this after my purchase so it wasn't a pity buy). It was only a small record shop but enough to keep me busy for half an hour. I went in looking for Green Day and David Bowie. I'd recently become interested in Bowie's earlier stuff after coming across a job lot of 175 7" for 35! This contained a couple of Bowie's singles including The Laughing Gnome which is an absolute joy to listen to. However, I purchased 2 Saxon vinyl, a Flotsam and Jetsam vinyl, a Kiss vinyl and a Dio vinyl. My overall spend was 70 so I was very happy. The Cult was a bit of a blind purchase, the store owner played a song for me to see if it liked it and I did. So I purchased it and loved the rest of the album

Just ordered one for myself! This picture persuaded me. Only came to 25 :)
Edit - Price
Christie Road would sound badass.

WRITING.TITLE: Lyrics to Basket Case as Top Comments

WRITING.TEXT: I have 3 other Roger Daltrey singles so it's a good start!
Oh...well, thanks for the info! :)

*Interesting
But for those wondering I managed to come across this is a job lot of 175 vinyl, I had suspicions from the title of the song but believe it was probably a coincidence then when I listened to it I was pleasantly surprised. So it is now the latest addition to my Green Day (and Green Day related) collection.

WRITING.TITLE: nteresting find from a vinyl job lot. (The song Green Day covered in the Dookie Demos)

WRITING.TITLE: Getting into Bowie and wondering where to go next
WRITING.TEXT: I currently own the Blackstar Vinyl, The Gospel According to Tony Day (with The Laughing Gnome B-Side which is an incredibly fun song) and also Let's Dance (with Cat People (Putting Out Fire) B-Side. I love all that I have heard and was wondering where to go next in terms of my next Bowie Vinyl, what would you all recommend? Thanks. :)
Woop, on my birthday :D
